pp2016.team19.server.comm

Class HandlerServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • pp2016.team19.server.comm.HandlerServer

  • public class HandlerServer
extends java.lang.Object

    Builds the connection for the Server and handles the receiving and the transmitting of messages.

    The HandlerServer Class is responsible for building the ServerSocket for the Server-Side and connecting with the Client. This Class submits methods for the Server-Engine in order to send and receive messages. Therefore it runs the Threads ReceiverServer and TransmitterServer. The TimerTask is also run for checking the connection between the Server and the Client.
    Author:
    Bulut , Taner , 5298261

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HandlerServer()
      Executes the init() method, so that the connection between the Server an the Client can be built.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HandlerServer

        public HandlerServer()
        Executes the init() method, so that the connection between the Server an the Client can be built.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Builds the ServerSocket for the Server-Side and starts the Threads for sending and receiving through ReceiverServer and TransmitterServer. Also listens to connections that want to be made to the ServerSocket. The TimerTask is also started for sending MessPing Messages to the Client.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closing the Socket, the TimerTask and stops the running of the application. This method allows to stop the connection between Server and Client. Starts the connection again with a Client-Socket.

      • getClient

        public java.net.Socket getClient()
        Returning the Socket 'client' that is connected to the ServerSocket
        Returns:
        the connected Socket of the Client-Side that is bound to the ServerSocket

      • getServer

        public java.net.ServerSocket getServer()
        Returning the ServerSocket 'server' that is connected to the Client
        Returns:
        the ServerSocket of the Server

      • sendMessageToClient

        public void sendMessageToClient(Message message)
        Sends messages to the Client by calling the writeMessage(Message) method of the transmitter instance
        Parameters:
        message - defines the Message that is written into the ObjectOutputStream and sent to the Client

      • getMessageFromClient

        public Message getMessageFromClient()
        Returns the messages from the Client by calling the getMessage() method of the receiver instance
        Returns:
        the Message-object that is read from the ObjectInputStream

      • setConnected

        public void setConnected(boolean connected)
        Sets the 'connected' attribute
        Parameters:
        connected - the boolean variable sets the connection state of the ServerSocket

        public boolean getConnected()
        Gets the 'connected' attribute
        Returns:
        the connection state of the ServerSocket

        Sets the 'closeNetwork' attribute
        Parameters:

        Gets the 'closeNetwork' attribute
